TopicTitle: The center of lift on probe cores is way off - I need help

Articles.Content:
Hello Kerbonauts!

I recently started to play again (v.  and started in science mode. I quickly started to notice, that I cannot get rockets higher than aprox 10,000m before they started to flip over. I went back to the VAB and found the center of lift some 20 meters below the probe core. I tried to raise it with several parts added to the rocket (tanks, wings, winglets whatever) but the center of lift stayed below the rocket itself. Interestingly this only happens with probe cores. I had no issues launching rockets with command pods and their center of lift is where it should be.

I had some mods installed and uninstalled them all. No changes. I uninstalled the game itself and reinstalled it, same result. As soon as I select a probe core and hit the show center of lift button, the blue ball is on the core for a second and then drops down 20 meter or so and stays there no matter what.

I am afraid, it has something to do with a mod. But I wonder why this still happens, even after an uninstall and reinstall of the game itself. I would like to add a picture but I am unable to. But I can add a list of mods I had installed when the error happend.

And what I just found: when I try to reinstall the game (via Steam) it shows a downloadsize of 7.8 Gb. When I start to download it will only download 1.8 Gb. So are there any leftovers after an unistall that a new install would use as well? Then there might be a corrupt ile in there, that causes the center of lift drops on probe cores? But where is it?

I hope someone can help! Thanks!

 

Mods:

The centre of lift can sometimes be misleading for rockets. A picture of the rocket that flips would be helpful to see if there’s something wrong with the design or if it’s a genuine game issue. A few small fins are usually enough for a 1.25m rocket.
